addressbook
Class Entry

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--addressbook.Entry
public class Entry
extends java.lang.Object

A class to maintain all of the information for a single entry in an AddressBook.

Constructor Summary
Entry(Person pers, Address addr)
          Constructor to create an Entry using the specified information.

Constructor Detail

Entry

public Entry(Person pers,
             Address addr)
Constructor to create an Entry using the specified information.

Parameters:
pers - the personal details for the entry.
addr - the address details for the entry.
Method Detail

getPerson

public Person getPerson()
Get the personal details associated with this Entry. This method returns a reference to the Person object stored in this Entry,so any changes made to that object will be reflected in the entry.

Returns:
the Person object for this entry.

getAddress

public Address getAddress()
Get the address details associated with this Entry. This method returns a reference to the Address object stored in this Entry,so any changes made to that object will be reflected in the entry.

Returns:
the Address object for this entry.

matchesPerson

public boolean matchesPerson(java.lang.String familyName,
                             java.lang.String givenNames)
Compare the specified family and given names with those of the Person stored in this Entry to see if they are the same. The comparison is case sensitive.

Returns:
true if familyName is exactly the same as getPerson().getFamilyName() AND givenNames is exactly the same as getPerson().getGivenNames(). If there are any differences (including case) between the parameters and the stored values, then this method will return false.

write

public void write(java.io.BufferedWriter writer)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write the data for this Entry using the specified Writer. The entry is written on a single line, with fields separated by commas. A line separator is written at the end of the record. The data for the written entry comes from the internally stored Person and Address objects, and is written in the following order: family name,given names,home phone,work phone,mobile phone,e-mail, house name/number,street,town,region,country,post code

Parameters:
writer - the BufferedWriter used to write the data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing

read

public static Entry read(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
                  throws BadRecordException,
                         java.io.IOException
Create a new Entry object by reading a record from the specified Reader, and parsing it into the constituent fields.

Parameters:
reader - the BufferedReader from which to read the data.
Returns:
an Entry object created from the next complete record available from the reader.
Throws:
BadRecordException - if the record contains too few or too many fields.
java.io.EOFException - if the reader has no more data to read.
java.io.IOException - if any other i/o error occurs during reading.
See Also:
write(java.io.BufferedWriter)

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Get a string representation of this Entry

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a multi-line string containing all of the entry details.
